@ursuperman222
Did you disconect from the internet before installing? I'd disconect, uninstall & try again.
Install programe, enter serial & then scan, when complete connect again, your drivers should then start downloading. Afterwards run the updates if you wish but dont try & register  on the website as it will fail!
I'm running windows 7 64 bit, it even detected a missing driver for my wireless mouse :-)

I am installing on WINXPPROSP3. I go offline. Install. Enter serial. Now, go back online.

When I attempt to update [driver DB], the program [repeatedly] attempts to download the main program [same version]. After the download, and install [again], I enter that serial [again]. Now, the program is back to "Trial". I can't get past the program update in order to do the Driver DB update. And, the program remains in "Trial" mode. Re-entering the serial when online or off has no effect. In the past, I was able to go offline, install, enter serial, and go back online. Sometimes, I would have to repeat this process, but it always worked.

Are there "hidden" files that have to be dealt with, or anything like that? I use Revo Uninstaller Pro to uninstall and then search out files and search out registry entries for a thorough uninstall.

Any ideas? This behavior of Drive Genius is new to me.
Anyone know how to "configure"/hack the "LiveUpdate" app to ignore the program update and just do the driver DB update?

I downloaded and installed today. After downloading torrent, I went offline, installed Driver Genuis, ran scan, entered serial (via copy and paste), hit okay to register to restart program. 

Worked fine for me. I am running Windows XP Home Edition.  

Thanks for the upload! Will seed for awhile.

If you update it, just use the same serial as provided, but remove ALL the dashes.
Eg.
BVADJM-PS89CP-GGQ6C4-59PNTT-FS6H5W-Q7SYSH

Becomes

BVADJMPS89CPGGQ6C459PNTTFS6H5WQ7SYSH

Enjoy! By the way, thanks you hellboy. for the great upload.

Running XP SP3 I installed the program, updated it once install finished, reopened program and entered serial without dashes. Once program restarted I was good to go! Didn't have to disconnect from the internet or anything. Thanks guys!

by the way if you try installing multiple drivers at a time you may run into issues like I have. I suggest you install one at a time but don't worry about restarting the computer after each one if it asks
thanks hellboy... this may have saved my pc!
